recipes: This situation requires discretion. Society considered our association improper.
Our relations were never formalised. It would be unthinkable that I would inherit a significant portion of the estate. Nevertheless, I have been well provided for.

Something has gone awry. Our former acquaintances cross the street when I pass. A newspaper hints at foul play. The solicitor will not receive me. I can expect no bequest, and there may be worse to come.
